refreshInterval-spinner.tooltip: Increase or decrease this spinner value to change the Refresh Interval

decimalsToShow-spinner.tooltip: Increase or decrease this spinner value to make the change the number of decimal places displayed

monitored-interface.description: Last Interface Monitored - no need to change as set by Applet:
monitored-interface.tooltip: This is normally set by the Applet and should not be changed here except for experimental or diagnostic use

useDefaultInterface.description: Use the following Interface as default to monitor when no other Interface is Active at start up :
useDefaultInterface.tooltip: Checking this box allows you to set up to use an interface for connections which is not always active at start up such as Wifi or Mobile Broadband - usually wlan0 or ppp0. If not checked the first active interface know to the Network Monitor will be used or PPP0 if that was the last connection.

defaultInterface.tooltip: The Default  interface to use for connections which are not always active at start up such as Mobile Broadband or Wifi - usually set to ppp0 or wlan0

compactDisplay.description: Use a Compact Display with total traffic only
compactDisplay.tooltip: This just displays the total of upload and download rate in the applet

appletWidthSetting.description: Applet Width Adjustment (Only for fine tuning - normally leave alone at 180:
appletWidthSetting.tooltip: Fine tuning of applet width for changes in theme and decimal places displayed - needs to be used in conjuction with changes in stylesheet.css. Value is halved when Compact Display selected

dataUnit.description: Data Unit used to set Alert Levels and Cumulative Offsets
dataUnit.tooltip: These are the units which will be used for setting the alert limit and cumulative offsets.

useTotalLimit.description: Check this box to use the Alert function
useTotalLimit.tooltip: This is useful for mobile broadband or where you may be paying for data on a Wifi link

totalLimit.units: Mbytes or Gbytes as set above
totalLimit.description: Data Limit before a Red Warning background is displayed in the Applet
totalLimit.tooltip: This is the Total Data which can be uploaded and downloaded before the background of the applet goes red - by default it goes orange at 80% of this - reset by disconnection, reboot and/or suspend depending on system

alertPercentage.description: Percentage of Data Limit at which Orange Warning Displayed
alertPercentage.tooltip: Percentage of Data Limit at which Orange Warning Background is displayed - It is also shown and can be adjusted in the Applet left click menu

cumulativeInterface1.description: Interface 1 for monitoring Cumulative Data Usage - null will inhibit display
cumulativeInterface1.tooltip: This is normally set to ppp0 or wlan0 to allow monitoring data usage during a period by mobile internet or Wifi charged by the Mbyte

cumulativeOffset1.units: Mbytes or Gbytes as set above
cumulativeOffset1.description: Offset applied to Cumulative Data Usage 1
cumulativeOffset1.tooltip: This can be used to offset the data usage to take into account usage on other machines or correct for other causes

cumulativeInterface2.description: Interface 2 for monitoring Cumulative Data Usage - null will inhibit display
cumulativeInterface2.tooltip: This is normally set to ppp0 or wlan0 to allow monitoring data usage during a period by mobile internet or Wifi charged by the Mbyte

cumulativeOffset2.units: Mbytes or Gbytes as set above
cumulativeOffset2.description: Offset applied to Cumulative Data Usage 2
cumulativeOffset2.tooltip: This can be used to offset the data usage to take into account usage on other machines or correct for other causes

cumulativeInterface3.description: Interface 3 for monitoring Cumulative Data Usage - null will inhibit display
cumulativeInterface3.tooltip: This is normally set to ppp0 or wlan0 to allow monitoring data usage during a period by mobile internet or Wifi charged by the Mbyte

cumulativeOffset3.units: Mbytes or Gbytes as set above
cumulativeOffset3.description: Offset applied to Cumulative Data Usage 3
cumulativeOffset3.tooltip: This can be used to offset the data usage to take into account usage on other machines or correct for other causes

useVnstat.description: Display long term traffic statistics (vnstat and vnstati Must be installed).
useVnstat.tooltip: This requires vnstat and vnstati to be installed prior to being enabled.

extendedDisplay.tooltip: This feature offers the Classic (original) display with optional of adding an hourly breakdown over the last 24 hours and an experimental option of a user defined string for vnstati when enabled below

vnstatiCommandString.description: Custom options to pass to vnstati - default is '-vs'
vnstatiCommandString.tooltip: The default is the options used for the extended display. Note: this is not the whole vnstati option string - the interface and output file options are added to it automatically. Please read the vnstati manual for further information on options avaiilable

useCrisisManagement.description: Take action when the current data usage limit is exceed
useCrisisManagement.tooltip: This is useful for mobile broadband or where you may be paying for data on a Wifi link as it can, for example, suspend the machine after the limit has been exceeded

crisisManagement.description: Action to take when Data Usage Limit exceeded:
crisisManagement.tooltip: These are a mixture of preset options and scripts which can be changed by the user (Note: changes in scripts may not survive an update and should be backed up)

disconnectDelay.description: Delay before Disabling Networking managed by NMClient
disconnectDelay.tooltip: This is the delay during which you can click the Applet to abort automatic disconnection of the machine when the Data Usage Limit is exceeded.

useAlertSound.description: Sound an audible alert when Data Usage Limit Exceeded
useAlertSound.tooltip: Only for built in alerts - hard code into scripts. Must have Sox installed

alertSound.tooltip: Must have Sox installed. Limited file types supported (.oga and .wav)

displayExtraHousekeeping.description: Add development and test functions to Context Menu
displayExtraHousekeeping.tooltip: Very useful for development of scripts and testing without actually exceeding a limit
